items.label: prop-bakry-emery-gamma2
items.title: Bakry-Émery Γ₂ Criterion (Conditional)
items.content:
985: :label: prop-bakry-emery-gamma2
986: 
987: C⁴ regularity of $V_{\text{fit}}$ ensures the Langevin generator $\mathcal{L} = \Delta - \nabla V_{\text{fit}} \cdot \nabla$ admits a well-defined Γ₂ operator:
988: 
989: $$
990: \Gamma_2(f, f) = \frac{1}{2}\mathcal{L}(\Gamma(f, f)) - \Gamma(f, \mathcal{L} f)
991: 
992: $$
993: 
994: where $\Gamma(f, f) = \|\nabla f\|^2$.
995: 
996: **Curvature hypothesis:** If the fitness potential satisfies the **Bakry-Émery curvature condition**:
997: 
998: $$
999: \Gamma_2(f, f) \ge \lambda_{\text{BE}} \Gamma(f, f) \quad \text{for some } \lambda_{\text{BE}} > 0
1000: 
1001: $$
1002: 
1003: (which is equivalent to $\text{Hess}(V_{\text{fit}}) \ge \lambda_{\text{BE}} I$ for the Langevin generator), then the semigroup $P_t$ is **hypercontractive**:
1004: 
1005: $$
1006: \|P_t f\|_{L^q} \le \|f\|_{L^p} \quad \text{for } q = 1 + (p - 1)e^{2\lambda_{\text{BE}} t}
1007: 
1008: $$

items.label: prop-timestep-c4
items.title: Time Step Constraint (Corrected)
items.content:
1056: :label: prop-timestep-c4
1057: 
1058: For numerical stability, both BAOAB and fourth-order integrators have the **same ρ-dependent constraint**: $\Delta t \lesssim \rho^{3/2}$
